headline.main: Ways to Eat Wisely, to Get Active Early On

docs.abstract: Excerpts of interview with Column by Yale-New Haven Pediatric Weight Management and Lipid Clinic head Dr Sonia Caprio, who comments on ways to prevent and correct childhood obesity; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: CHILDREN are watching too much television, eating junk food and feeling lonely in a society where parents have less time for them. That's how Dr. Sonia Caprio explains a disturbing problem: the nation's children have been gaining weight. Dr. Caprio, an associate professor in pediatric endocrinology at Yale, has spent the last few years looking at markers and predictors of childhood obesity for a National Institutes of Health study. She also contributed to the ''The Yale Guide to Children's Nutrition,'' recently published by Yale University Press.
